summary: This is an FBI News Briefing dated August 25, 2020, covering a wide range of national and international news topics including protests in Kenosha, Wisconsin following the police shooting of Jacob Blake, various criminal investigations, counter-intelligence cases, and political developments. The document is a daily intelligence summary for FBI leadership.

persons.name: Jacob Blake
persons.context: Black man shot in the back by police in Kenosha, Wisconsin, sparking violent protests. He was out of surgery and in stable condition as of the document date.

persons.name: Tony Evers
persons.context: Called in the National Guard to Kenosha after protests and called a special legislative session on policing accountability.

persons.name: Pete Deates
persons.role: President of Kenosha Professional Police Association
persons.context: Issued statement urging public to withhold judgment on Blake shooting and criticizing Governor Evers' statement as irresponsible.

persons.name: Joe Biden
persons.context: Called for investigation into Blake shooting and denounced systemic racism, but did not condemn the subsequent rioting according to some reports.

persons.name: Mark Morgan
persons.context: Blamed violence in cities on failure of state and local leadership, specifically mentioning Portland protests.

persons.name: James Craig
persons.context: Said Detroit police prevented protesters from setting up a 'zone of lawlessness' similar to Seattle.

persons.name: Zhengdong Cheng
persons.context: Charged with fraud and conspiracy for concealing affiliations with Chinese institutions while working on NASA-funded research.

persons.name: Bill Priestap
persons.context: Senator Lindsey Graham said he would subpoena Priestap regarding the Trump-Russia investigation and Steele dossier.

persons.name: Alexsei Navalny
persons.context: German doctors confirmed he was poisoned with a cholinesterase inhibitor and was in a medically induced coma.

persons.name: George Floyd
persons.context: Federal authorities were moving toward resolution of probe into his killing, with potential federal charges forthcoming.

persons.name: Daniel Cameron
persons.context: Mulling charges in Breonna Taylor probe, waiting on FBI ballistics tests.

persons.name: Scott Peterson
persons.context: California Supreme Court overturned his death penalty for killing his wife Laci, though conviction was upheld.

persons.name: Leila Cavett
persons.context: FBI investigating her disappearance in Florida; her toddler son was found alone.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Mentioned in multiple contexts including visiting North Carolina, announcing plasma treatment authorization, and commenting on mail-in voting.

persons.name: Louis DeJoy
persons.context: Testified before House Oversight Committee, denying he was sabotaging the election and refusing to replace removed mail sorting machines.

persons.name: Nancy Pelosi
persons.context: Called Trump and his allies 'enemies of the state' regarding voting system concerns.

persons.name: Mike Pompeo
persons.context: Urged other Arab countries to follow UAE in recognizing Israel during trip to Jerusalem.

persons.name: Benjamin Netanyahu
persons.context: Met with Pompeo, called UAE agreement a boon to peace and regional stability.

persons.name: Svetlana Tikhanovskaya
persons.context: Met with US Deputy Secretary of State Stephen Biegun after fleeing Belarus.

persons.name: Jair Bolsonaro
persons.context: Popularity rising despite COVID-19 response that resulted in 114,000 deaths in Brazil.

persons.name: Erin O'Toole
persons.role: New Conservative Party leader in Canada
persons.context: Selected as new leader of Canada's Conservative Party.

persons.name: Letitia James
persons.context: Investigating whether Trump inflated asset values to get loans or tax benefits, seeking to compel testimony from Eric Trump and others.

persons.name: Eric Trump
persons.role: Executive Vice President at Trump Organization
persons.context: Subject of New York AG investigation, accused of being uncooperative and refusing to testify.

persons.name: Michael Cohen
persons.context: In talks to appear in ads for Democratic PAC and releasing a tell-all book; his information triggered NY AG investigation.

persons.name: Lezmond Mitchell
persons.role: Navajo man on federal death row
persons.context: Scheduled for execution, raising tribal sovereignty concerns as the only Native American on federal death row.

persons.name: Christina Korbe
persons.context: Sought compassionate release from prison after contracting COVID-19; killed Special Agent Samuel Hicks in 2008.

persons.name: Samuel Hicks
persons.context: Killed by Christina Korbe during a 2008 raid to arrest her drug dealer husband.

connections.description: Evers responded to Blake's shooting by calling in National Guard and calling for police reform.
Deates criticized Evers' statement on Blake shooting as 'wholly irresponsible'.
Trump criticized Biden's openness to new lockdowns; Biden criticized Trump's handling of protests and pandemic.
Graham plans to subpoena Priestap regarding the Trump-Russia investigation.
Met in Jerusalem to discuss regional security and Israel's relationships with Arab nations.
James seeking to compel Eric Trump's testimony in investigation of Trump Organization finances.
Cohen was Trump's former attorney now cooperating with investigations and planning to release tell-all book.
Pelosi accused DeJoy and Trump of being 'enemies of the state' regarding postal service changes.

events.title: Jacob Blake shooting
events.description: Police in Kenosha, Wisconsin shot Jacob Blake in the back as he tried to enter his car with his children, sparking violent protests.

events.title: Portland protests continue
events.description: Police used tear gas to disperse protesters in Portland who hurled rocks, bottles, and fireworks at officers, with 23 arrests.

events.title: FDA emergency authorization for convalescent plasma
events.description: FDA issued emergency use authorization for convalescent plasma treatment for COVID-19, announced by President Trump.

events.title: Navalny poisoning confirmed
events.description: German doctors confirmed Russian opposition leader Alexsei Navalny was poisoned with a cholinesterase inhibitor.

events.title: House Oversight Committee hearing on USPS
events.description: Postmaster General Louis DeJoy testified before House committee, denying he was sabotaging the election.

events.title: NY AG investigation into Trump Organization
events.description: New York Attorney General Letitia James asked court to compel testimony from Eric Trump and others in fraud investigation.

events.title: Scheduled execution of Lezmond Mitchell
events.description: Federal execution scheduled for Lezmond Mitchell, only Native American on federal death row, raising tribal sovereignty concerns.

events.title: Border shootout in Arizona
events.description: Man led Border Patrol on chase and shot at agents while trying to smuggle undocumented migrants through checkpoints.

locations: Cape Canaveral Air Force Station, Florida
keyFacts: Jacob Blake was shot in the back by police in Kenosha, Wisconsin on August 23, 2020, sparking violent protests and leading Governor Tony Evers to call in the National Guard.
German doctors confirmed Russian opposition leader Alexsei Navalny was poisoned with a cholinesterase inhibitor, contradicting Russian doctors' claims.
New York Attorney General Letitia James is investigating whether the Trump Organization inflated asset values for loans and tax benefits, seeking to compel testimony from Eric Trump.
The FDA issued emergency use authorization for convalescent plasma treatment for COVID-19, which President Trump claimed would reduce mortality by 'at least 35%'.
Postmaster General Louis DeJoy testified before Congress that he was not 'sabotaging the election' despite removing mail sorting machines and implementing changes that caused delivery delays.
